title: La Bamba
lines: Se necesita una poca de gracia
Una poca de gracia y otra cosita
Yo no soy marinero, soy capitán

vocabulary.explanation: Verb meaning to move your body rhythmically to music
A lively Mexican and Puerto Rican folk dance and music genre
Third person singular present of necesitar (to need)
Small amount or quantity of something
Elegance, style, or skill in one's movements or behavior
Diminutive form of cosa (thing); something small or trivial
Exclamation meaning 'up!' or 'come on!'; also means upward direction
A person who works on a ship or vessel
A senior officer in charge of a ship or military unit

title: El Loco
lines: Soy muy loco, muy loco, muy loco
Yo me escapé de un manicomio

vocabulary.explanation: Someone who is mentally unstable or behaves in an erratic way
Past tense of escapar (to escape); means to get away from a place
A hospital or institution for people with mental illness
Past tense of encontrar (to find); can also mean to encounter
Literally an old woman; colloquially used to mean mother or girlfriend

title: Despierta
lines: Despierta, que el mundo te espera
No pierdas tiempo en cosas vanas

vocabulary.explanation: Imperative form of despertar (to wake up); can also mean 'be aware'
Third person singular of esperar (to wait); patience or hope
To move or travel through a place or distance
Second person singular subjunctive of perder (to lose)
Meaningless or without substance; wasteful of time
Second person singular of perseguir (to pursue or chase after)
Plural of sueño; goals and aspirations or what you see when sleeping
To end or stop doing something (from the verb cesar)
